articles.title: Rafael Nadal stunned by remarkable comeback as Stefanos Tsitsipas dumps him out of Australian Open
articles.description: Rafael Nadal will have to wait to win his 21st grand slam and etch his name into the history books after a stunning comeback from Stefanos Tsitsipas dumped him out of the Australian Open.

articles.title: The curious story behind the pandemic's weirdest chart
articles.description: Americans are spending less on their credit cards since the pandemic started. But, unlike other economic data points that are inching towards recovery, such as retail sales or the unemployment rate, credit card spending remains in decline.

articles.author: Duarte Mendonca, Al Goodman and Sarah Dean, CNN
articles.title: Rapper's arrest sparks protests in Catalonia
articles.description: Protesters took to the streets in Barcelona and Girona, in Spain's northeastern Catalonia region, on Tuesday night following the dramatic arrest of rapper Pablo Hasel earlier in the day.

articles.title: New York Attorney General sues Amazon, alleging 'deficient' Covid-19 response
articles.description: New York is taking Amazon to court over claims that the company has failed to provide sufficient protections for its workers during the Covid-19 pandemic.

articles.author: Joan Biskupic, CNN legal analyst & Supreme Court biographer
articles.title: Right-wing justices think religion is under siege. Will the full Supreme Court follow?
articles.description: The Supreme Court has increasingly exempted religious believers from government regulations, and it is clear by their statements that individual justices on the right think religion is under siege in America.

articles.author: Danielle Wiener-Bronner, CNN Business
articles.title: Burger King will replace its chicken sandwich as competition grows fierce
articles.description: Burger King doesn't want to come out a loser in fast food's chicken sandwich wars. So it's planning an upgrade.

articles.author: Nimi Princewill, for CNN
articles.title: Nigerian entrepreneur jailed for 10 years in $11m email scam
articles.description: Celebrated Nigerian entrepreneur Obinwanne Okeke has been jailed for 10 years by a US federal court for masterminding an $11 million cyber fraud on a British company.

articles.title: Jeff Bezos overtakes Elon Musk to become the world's richest person again
